blocks.name: cmbfm
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the measurable functions builder.

diff.cmbfm.w
df-mbfm
blocks.content: Define the measurable function builder, which generates the set of measurable functions from a measurable space to another one. Here, the measurable spaces are given using their sigma-algebras ` s ` and ` t ` , and the spaces themselves are recovered by ` U. s ` and ` U. t ` . Note the similarities between the definition of measurable functions in measure theory, and of continuous functions in topology. This is the definition for the generic measure theory. For the specific case of functions from ` RR ` to ` CC ` , see ~ df-mbf . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mbfm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cmbfm, cmpo(s0, s1, cuni(crn(csiga)), cuni(crn(csiga)), crab(s2, co(cuni(cv(s1)), cmap, cuni(cv(s0))), wral(s3, cv(s1), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s2)), cv(s3)), cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}

  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s3)

}

blocks.name: 2ndmbfm
blocks.content: The second projection map is measurable with regard to the product sigma-algebra. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Jun-2017.)

blocks.name: imambfm
blocks.content: If the sigma-algebra in the range of a given function is generated by a collection of basic sets ` K ` , then to check the measurability of that function, we need only consider inverse images of basic sets ` a ` . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 4-Jun-2017.)

blocks.name: cnmbfm
blocks.content: A continuous function is measurable with respect to the Borel Algebra of its domain and range. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnmbfm(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmbfm, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c3, ccn, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(csigagen, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(csigagen, c4)))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmbfm, c2)), wf(c0, cuni(c1), cuni(c2)), wral(hs0, c4, wcel(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c1)))
  mpbird(w0, wf(c0, cuni(c1), cuni(c2)), wf(c0, cuni(c3), cuni(c4)))

blocks.content: The composition of two measurable functions is measurable. ( cf. ~ cnmpt11 ) (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 4-Jun-2017.)

thm mbfmco(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(ccom(c0, c1), co(c2, cmbfm, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c2, cmbfm, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c4, cmbfm, c3)))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(ccom(c0, c1), co(c2, cmbfm, c3)), wcel(ccom(c0, c1), co(cuni(c3), cmap, cuni(c2))), wral(hs0, c3, wcel(cima(ccnv(ccom(c0, c1)), cv(hs0)), c2)))
  mpbird(w0, wcel(ccom(c0, c1), co(cuni(c3), cmap, cuni(c2))), wf(ccom(c0, c1), cuni(c2), cuni(c3)))
  syl2anc(w0, wf(ccom(c0, c1), cuni(c2), cuni(c3)), wf(c0, cuni(c4), cuni(c3)), wf(c1, cuni(c2), cuni(c4)))
  mbfmf(c0, c4, c3, w0)
  mbfmf(c1, c2, c4, w0)
  fco(c0, cuni(c4), cuni(c3), c1, cuni(c2))
  elmapd(ccom(c0, c1), cuni(c3), cuni(c2), c3, c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(cuni(c3), c3), wcel(c3, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  unielsiga(c3)
  syl(w0, wcel(cuni(c2), c2), wcel(c2, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  unielsiga(c2)
  ralrimiva(hs0, c3, w0, wcel(cima(ccnv(ccom(c0, c1)), cv(hs0)), c2))
  syl5eqel(cima(ccnv(ccom(c0, c1)), cv(hs0)), c2, cima(ccnv(c1), cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  eqtri(cima(ccnv(ccom(c0, c1)), cv(hs0)), cima(ccnv(c1), cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0))), cima(ccom(ccnv(c1), ccnv(c0)), cv(hs0)))
  imaeq1i(ccnv(ccom(c0, c1)), cv(hs0), ccom(ccnv(c1), ccnv(c0)))
  cnvco(c0, c1)
  imaco(ccnv(c1), ccnv(c0), cv(hs0))
  mbfmcnvima(c1, cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c2, c4, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c2, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c1, co(c2, cmbfm, c4)))
  mbfmcnvima(c0, cv(hs0), c4, c3, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c4, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c3, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c0, co(c4, cmbfm, c3)))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3))
  ismbfm(hs0, ccom(c0, c1), c2, c3, w0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(ccom(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}

blocks.name: mbfmvolf
blocks.content: Measurable functions with respect to the Lebesgue measure are real-valued functions on the real numbers. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Mar-2017.)

thm mbfmvolf(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(cdm(cvol), cmbfm, cbrsiga)), wf(c0, cr, cr))
} = {
  sylibr(wcel(c0, co(cdm(cvol), cmbfm, cbrsiga)), wf(c0, cr, cr), wf(c0, cuni(cdm(cvol)), cuni(cbrsiga)))

  a1i(wcel(c0, co(cdm(cvol), cmbfm, cbrsiga)), wcel(cdm(cvol), cuni(crn(csiga))))
  simpli(wcel(cdm(cvol), cuni(crn(csiga))), wceq(cr, cuni(cdm(cvol))))
  a1i(wcel(c0, co(cdm(cvol), cmbfm, cbrsiga)), wcel(cbrsiga, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  simpli(wcel(cbrsiga, cuni(crn(csiga))), wceq(cr, cuni(cbrsiga)))
  id(wcel(c0, co(cdm(cvol), cmbfm, cbrsiga)))
  feq23i(c0, cr, cr, cuni(cdm(cvol)), cuni(cbrsiga))
  simpri(wceq(cr, cuni(cdm(cvol))), wcel(cdm(cvol), cuni(crn(csiga))))
  mpbi(wa(wcel(cdm(cvol), cuni(crn(csiga))), wceq(cr, cuni(cdm(cvol)))), wcel(cdm(cvol), cfv(csiga, cr)))
  dmvlsiga()
  issgon(cdm(cvol), cr)
  simpri(wceq(cr, cuni(cbrsiga)), wcel(cbrsiga, cuni(crn(csiga))))
  mpbi(wa(wcel(cbrsiga, cuni(crn(csiga))), wceq(cr, cuni(cbrsiga))), wcel(cbrsiga, cfv(csiga, cr)))
  brsigarn()
  issgon(cbrsiga, cr)
}
